column4: hi, why nautilus telling me that there's no space left (0 bytes) when I just removed more than a 100MB of files?
after, df -h, what should i expect to happen?
will it try to clean up?
you will see your partition use in (-h)umanly readable form
you have too much data on /   you are using 6.1Gb or 6.4Gb, you need to uninstall some apps
you home partition is fine, its / you need to empty a little
does ubuntu disallow any new file to be created once it reached critical size limit?
i'd imagine so, read through: dpkg -l | less and uninstall apps you don't use
like pdf viewers, grapics packages, digital camera support etc etc
gimp is quite heavy if you never use it, get rid
you need to carve some apps out
you care gonna have to keep trimming
do you NEED all the apps in the dpkg -l list?
